meanings.definition: Prevent or obstruct (an anticipated event or action) by taking action ahead of time.
meanings.sent1: She forestalls any potential issues by planning ahead.
meanings.sent2: The security guard forestalls theft by keeping a close eye on the store.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox forestalls the farmer's attempts to catch him by using different escape routes.
meanings.sent4: The superhero forestalls disaster by arriving just in time to save the city.
meanings.sent5: The early bird forestalls competition by getting the worm first.

meanings.definition: Anticipate and deal with (a situation) in advance.
meanings.sent1: He always forestalls any problems by preparing for every scenario.
meanings.sent2: The experienced teacher forestalls student questions by addressing common concerns in the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The detective forestalls the criminal's escape plan by setting up a trap.
meanings.sent4: The wise leader forestalls conflicts by promoting open communication among team members.
meanings.sent5: The weather forecaster forestalls travel disruptions by warning about an incoming storm.
